questions.paragraph: Milk is considered a liquid matter. Explain.
popup: Milk is considered a liquid because it has a constant volume, and takes the shape of its container.

questions.paragraph: A book is considered a matter. Explain.
popup: Because a book has a mass and occupies a volume.

questions.paragraph: What will happen to the state of water when it is heated for several minutes?
popup: The speed of the particles increases as they move apart, and the water changes into water vapor.

questions.paragraph: What happens to the speed of the particles of matter when its state changes from liquid to solid?
popup: The speed of the particles decreases, and they move slowly.

questions.paragraph: Why do we need an electron microscope to examine particles of different materials?
popup: Because the particles of matter are extremely small and cannot be seen with the naked eye.

questions.paragraph: Mona poured mango juice from the bottle into the glass. Will its volume change? Why?
popup: No, because the volume of liquid matter is fixed.

questions.paragraph: Heba left a container of water in the sun for a while, and when she returned, she didn't find the water in the container. What is the reason for this?
popup: As temperature rises, water changes into water vapor.

questions.paragraph: Identify the state of matter in each picture, based on the way its particles are bonded.
Identify the tool that scientists use to see the particles of those materials.
